metadata.title: CVE-2024-35806 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: soc:fsl: qbman: Always disable interrupts when taking cgr_locksmp_call_function_single disables IRQs when executing the callback. Toprevent deadlocks, we must disable IRQs when taking cgr_lock elsewhere.This is already done by qman_update_cgr and qman_delete_cgr; fix the otherlockers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-116-generic - 5.15.0-116.126
linux-image-5.15.0-116-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-116.126
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-116-generic - 5.15.0-116.126
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-116-generic-64k - 5.15.0-116.126
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1062-kvm - 5.15.0-1062.67
No subscription required
